bigger or smaller than specified add or subtract stitches in multiples of 3 s for example if you wanted to make your cap a bit bigger you might cast on 99 stitches rather than the 96 that the pattern calls for techniques 1 invisible join in the round slip the first cast-on stitch from the left needle to the right needle purl-wise being careful not to twist now slip the last cast-on stitch over the first from the right needle to the left needle being careful not to drop it slip the stitch on the right needle back over to the left needle and placing a marker on the right needle knit these two stitches together as one you have essentially swapped the first and last cast-on stitches which creates a nice and tidy join 2 1 x 1 ribbing *k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round 3 2 x 1 ribbing *k2 p1
